chart_description: This chart displays the rate of softirqs handled by the CPU per second. Softirqs are software interrupts that are executed in the context of the kernel.

dimension_descriptions.BLOCK: The number of block devices that are being serviced.
dimension_descriptions.NET_RX: The rate of softirqs processed for incoming network packets.
dimension_descriptions.NET_TX: The rate of softirqs processed for outgoing network packets.
dimension_descriptions.RCU: The number of RCU (Read-Copy-Update) callbacks being processed. RCU is a synchronization mechanism used in the Linux kernel.
dimension_descriptions.SCHED: The number of softirqs triggered due to task scheduling requests.
dimension_descriptions.TASKLET: The rate of softirqs generated by tasklets. Tasklets are functions that are scheduled to run in interrupt context.
dimension_descriptions.TIMER: The number of softirqs triggered by timer events.
